definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: The separation-type of sound change is one of the sound changes in the Mongolian language.
sentences.chinese: 離散式音變是蒙古語的一種音變現象。

sentences.english: The separation-type of sound change is one of the sound changes in the Mongolian language.
sentences.chinese: 離散式音變是蒙古語的一種音變現象。

sentences.english: All these changes appear in the form of sandhi, and in form of lexical diffusion as well.
sentences.chinese: 其變化既有連續性音變方式，也有詞彙擴散方式。

sentences.english: NO12,9. My voice is getting hoarse.
Her voice deepened when she came to these lines of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她讀到信中這幾行時，她的聲音變低沉了。

sentences.english: Smaller reverbs or short delays make things sound bigger.
sentences.chinese: 小混響和短延遲使得聲音變豐滿。

sentences.english: In Gaoyou dialect, the phenomenon of sound change has representativeness in Jiang-huai dialect.
sentences.chinese: 高郵話的音變現象在江淮方言中極具代表性。

sentences.english: Increasing pressure on the strings is the primary way to produce louder notes on the violin.
sentences.chinese: 加大弓對弦的壓力是使小提琴聲音變響的主要方法。

sentences.english: With neck pick-up, bass tones begins to dominate general sound.
sentences.chinese: 要是施用琴頸拾音器，低音變的很低沉。

definition: radical of a compound word (in European language)
phonetic component of a Chinese character
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
reading or phonetic value of a character
high and level tone, the first tone of putonghua
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
